content: Added "write answer" to stub generator so that the initial default code shows the syntax for debugging and outputting the answer.
On O(n²) solutions passes without problem in C.  Approving anyway.

I like it. Solved, upvoted, edited and approved.

I do have to wonder, though, if the input size is big enough to rule out brute solutions.

Hello JBM,

Thanks for your feedback !

I don't know if there is a limit in Codingame input length (and where to find it). 
I can generate a longer input but from what I've read, the naive algorithm has a  complexity of O(n²). The manacher's algorithm is the only one running in O(n).
I timed the last tests and I need around 250 ms to solve it. With a algorithm in O(n²), it won't be possible to do it in less than a second.

Moreover, I solved it in Python3. If I increase the sequence, maybe some languages won't be fast enougth to solve it (for example VBA or javascript)

I'll maybe add a final test with a input which is a full palindrom of 5000 chars.
Thanks for your feedback the info about a solution in O(n²) ! Unfortunately I don't see any way to make it more "difficult" :(

The current input size limit, AFAIK, is 10k. BUT  think the output size has a 1k limit (that one to be checked).

Yes, I think a full-length palindrome would be appropriate.
And maybe also a double almost-full-length one (abababab...ab)

I used an O(n) that isn't Manacher, hah!

I checked and you are right, input is limited to 10k and output to 1k. 
I've added a 10k chars input with 1k chars palindrom. I that case, I don't know if it makes sense to create a 1k input word which is also 1k palindrom. This would be a mix of test 1 + test 7.

I'll add a double almost-full-length one :)
